response.overview: A documentary that recovers the memory of the victims of military terror during the last dictatorship that ravaged Argentina between 1976 and 1983, through the testimonies of mothers and relatives of the disappeared, former political prisoners, and exiles. A rich collection of images of marches, rallies, footage from detention centers, and hundreds of photographs enrich the narrative. The story is told and presented like a giant puzzle, where dozens of voices tell us about the search for their families, how they fought, how they resisted, and how today that pain has been transformed into creative energy in the search for truth and justice.
response.title: Nadie olvida nada
